com.percussion.rx.delivery
Interface IPSDeliveryHandler

public interface IPSDeliveryHandler

A delivery handler is responsible for delivering assembled content to a location determined by a location scheme or by the assembly process itself. The delivery handler manages the delivery and may optionally perform the delivery in a transactional manner.

Delivery handlers are invoked in a multi-threaded environment and must be coded accordingly, with global data properly protected from simultaneous thread access.

The use of the word transactional in this context does not refer to the standard ACID criteria. Rather it really talks about the delivery handler buffering the published changes to the end of the job, and applying those as an all or nothing batch. This enables us to keep web sites more generally consistent, longer than if we were outputting changes on a per delivery mechanism.

Author:
dougrand

Method Detail

init

void init(long jobid,
          IPSSite site)
Initialize the delivery handler for the given job. This method will be called once by the delivery manager the first time assembled content is to be delivered by the given handler.

Parameters:
jobid - the job id, never repeated within any reasonable period of time. In practice, since this is a long, it will never, ever be repeated.
site - the site, never null.

isTransactional

boolean isTransactional()
Return whether this plug in is transactional. Transactional plug ins postpone deliveries and removals until the commit(long) or the rollback(long) method is called. Otherwise the content is immediately delivered or removed.

Returns:
true is the plug in supports transactional behavior.

deliver

IPSDeliveryResult deliver(IPSDeliveryItem deliveryItem)
The deliver method delivers or queues a single item for delivery. If the handler is transactional then the item is not actually delivered until the commit(long) method is called. Otherwise the item is delivered immediately.

Deliver is also called for handlers that remove items using assembly results. Such cases call this method instead of remove(IPSDeliveryItem)

Parameters:
deliveryItem - the item to be delivered, never null.
Returns:
the delivery result, which includes any failures occurring during immediate delivery and any immediate validation errors for transactional delivery. The delivery result also contains the unpublishing information for the given result.

remove

IPSDeliveryResult remove(IPSDeliveryItem deliveryItem)
The remove method removes or queues for removal a single item. If the handler is transactional then the item is not actually removed until the commit(long) method is called. Otherwise the item is removed immediately.

Parameters:
deliveryItem - the item to be removed, never null and must have non-null unpublishing information present.
Returns:
the delivery result, see deliver(IPSDeliveryItem) for details.

commit

Collection<IPSDeliveryResult> commit(long jobId)
                                     throws com.percussion.rx.delivery.PSDeliveryException
If transactional, then commit any stored results to the final location, then free any held resources for the given job. Never called if not transactional, and should be implemented to do nothing in this case.

Errors during commit can result in some items being delivered while others are not, leaving the destination site in an inconsistent state.

Parameters:
jobId - the job id.
Returns:
the statistics for the job if the handler is transactional, or null for non-transactional handlers.
Throws:
PSDeliveryException

rollback

void rollback(long jobId)
              throws com.percussion.rx.delivery.PSDeliveryException
If transactional, then simply discard any held work, then free any held resources for the given job. Never called if not transactional, and should be implemented to do nothing in this case.

Parameters:
jobId - the job id.
Throws:
PSDeliveryException - on failure
